meanings.definition: To place things one on top of the other.
meanings.sent1: She piled the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The kids piled up their toys in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel piled nuts in a messy stack.
meanings.sent4: Time piled up like a mountain of moments.
meanings.sent5: The leaves piled high, creating a colorful mound.

meanings.definition: To accumulate or gather in a heap.
meanings.sent1: He piled the coins on the table to count them.
meanings.sent2: The snow piled up outside the window.
meanings.sent3: The laundry piled in a chaotic heap on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Worries piled up in her mind like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The dishes piled high in the sink after the party.

meanings.definition: To move quickly in a disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: The kids piled out of the classroom after the bell rang.
meanings.sent2: People piled into the bus as it arrived.
meanings.sent3: The puppies piled around the food bowl excitedly.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts piled into her mind, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The leaves piled up in the wind, swirling around in a frenzy.
